name: Dungeon Souls
description: Dungeon Souls is an action-adventure roguelike dungeon crawler which draws heavy inspiration from Nuclear Throne, Risk of Rain, and Overture. Explore vast procedurally generated dungeons, collect loot, and slay hordes of challenging enemies!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: 2.9 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 256 MB DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 200 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7/10 Processor: 2.9 GHz or higher Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 1 GB or higher DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 200 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Extremely visually noisey, slow combat grind fests, and no real sense of how anything works, with references to controller inputs and no buttons seemign to do anything.  The game was better in its initial EA release, I'm not certain what this is.
I've lost so many good runs to boulder traps.   10/10

What can i say? There are souls in a dungeon!  Ok so Dungeon Souls is a pretty good duplicate of the game 'Enter the Gungeon' except, in my eyes, its better. There are different types of heroes such as Barbarian, magic dude and Archer. There is 1 pre-unlocked power and 2 specials. There are item shops, levelling up and more. So what can i say? Its good.    Pros   Good Atmosphere Great Magic System (Potions) Boss Battle?! Different Dungeons Challenging    Cons   Hardcore Graphic issues occasionally  9/10

Really good game but also has it's flaws. The difficulty is toned down from other games of this genre and the game feels kind of grindy. Some of the bosses and areas don't feel very polished or bug out and the Necromancer character is extremely overpowered. Overall it's a 7/10

This game was fun in the beginning, however after a 6 hours run (which the last 2 were boring as hell) the game shuts down with the error message 'Out of memory!' and I lost EVERYTHING. That's unacceptable. I'm never launching this again

DS is not fun to play. In early access, your toon moved very quickly and it was very exciting to decimate packs of mobs. Now....you move like a tortoise. I put every one of my leveling points into movement speed just to move slightly faster. Playing with a controller is also not fun. You have to jam the right stick all the way in certain directions to face that direction and if you play a melee class, its just...unbearable. Melee has always been gimped in DS. The dev tried to rectify this by making them be meat shields. Basically they could absorb a bunch of damage becuase they had to. Every mob in this game can pretty much hit you while you're a melee class. You have to constantly been edging back and forth so you don't always get hit but it happens quite frequently. I would say, just play archer or any range class. However, with the nerf to movement speed, even those classes aren't fun.

Very fun and challenging game with lots of characters to play. Just crazy dungeon crawling madness. Awesome boss battles. RNG items. a cheap awesome dungeon crawling experience. The only complaint, no online multiplayer.
